Vinyl LP | RCA/Victor LSP 10308 | Hard Rock | UK


 From Rateyourmusic:
 This is evidently one of the rarest hard rock albums of it's era, now commanding 
huge sums for original copies. Interesting this, because it lacks the kind of 
pre-metal power usually necessary for a record to achieve those levels of 
desirability. There's some distortion, some fairly driving tracks, some slight 
sinister vibes and some good songs ("To Greet The Sun," "The Sacrifice," 
"The Journey") but a great deal of it is also directionless middle of the road 
rock. Heavy heads will probably want to check it out, just don't expect fuzz 
drenched, earth moving psych density mega metal, okay?
